results.title: The Techniques of tempera and oil painting
results.creator_credit: Peter Coltman and University of Glasgow Television Service
results.brief_description: Using a fifteenth century document as a source the film describes the preparation and techniques of tempera and oil painting, including gilding. Narrated by Mac Ritchie. Written and demonstrated by James Hickey.

results.title: The Swan song by Anton Chekhov
results.brief_description: The curtain rises in an old theatre, the audience and the cleaning women have all gone home. It is dark and musty and the stage has been cleared of all scenery. There is silence. Then a candlelight appears, illuminating a face…it is the face of The Actor, rouged, lined and old. The Actor encounters someone else, the Theatre Prompter, who becomes an unwilling audience and the two men share each other’s loneliness on the darkened stage. Adapted from Chekhov’s 1886 stage version of his short story, the film illustrates the adaptability of the short story form to a moving, audiovisual experience.

results.title: The Swallowtail story: the life history of an English butterfly
results.brief_description: Shows the English swallowtail butterfly in its British habitat, the extensive areas of reed beds round the Norfolk Broads in East Anglia, together with other wild life in the district. The conflict with human activities, either by drainage of the fens to provide more agricultural land, or holiday pursuits such as sailing on the Broads, is shown as well as the steps taken to ensure the future conservation of this beautiful insect. Commentary and entomology by Victor Bascombe.

results.title: The Sun is our star
results.brief_description: The sun is the Earth’s source of energy and life. Describes the nature of the sun’s rays - ultra violet, infra red, heat and radio waves. Discusses solar spots, solar eclipses, and the polar aurora, their causes and effects such as electrical storms and radio disturbances.

results.title: The Story of time
results.creator_credit: Jan Coolen, Robert Leffingwell and Signal Films
results.brief_description: Part animated film dramatising man’s attempts over the centuries to measure time. Sun worshippers measured the hours by the shades of obelisk and sun-dial; the first clocks were worked by the elements - such as the sand glass, the Chinese fire clock, and the Persian water clock. The mechanical clocks and pocket watches of the last two centuries are symbolised by a ballet of pendulums, leading to the precision instruments that are the clocks and watches of the present day, measuring time with great accuracy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan Coolen, Robert Leffingwell and Signal Films

results.title: The Story of the Timna copper miner
results.brief_description: King Solomon’s mines were rediscovered by geologists, who found the old copper deposits. Laboratory research led to the development of suitable production methods in these difficult conditions of burning heat. Ore is blasted, treated with sulphuric acid in order to separate the copper.
results.title_for_label: The Story of the Timna copper miner

results.title: The Story of the Bees
results.creator_credit: Andrei Vinnitsky and Moscow Technical Film Studios
results.brief_description: A fascinating story of life inside the wild bees’ hive, revealing details which only the camera can show of the organisation and care of the hive and the queen. “The Story of the bees” is a shortened version of a film entitled “Sunny tribe” which was designed to show that bees are guided by instinct, not by reason. “Sunny tribe” won an award at the Cannes International Film Festival in 1946.

results.title: The Story of gin
results.brief_description: The production of gin from cereal grains - wheat, barley or maize, pure water, and aromatic herbs. Shows four main stages - the cleaning and grinding of the grain; cooking and fermentation with the addition of malt and yeast; distillation of gin by adding juniper berries and other exotic herbs. Bottling, sealing and labelling completes the process. Shows constant quality control tests.

results.title: The Story of Elizabeth Hayward
results.brief_description:
After stealing seven shilling’s worth of silk, Elizabeth Hayward gets sent to Australia in chains. She recounts, in a letter to her parents, her horrific journey and experience of malnutrition and violent treatment of convicts by white colonials and of her desire to be back home with her parents.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
